Statement: DEL-05-02 implements SOW-0013: Building durability/ease of repair and maintenance narrative (structural systems)
EvidenceQuote: SOW-0013: Building durability/ease of repair and maintenance narrative (structural systems)
Notes: FACT. SOW-0013 confirmed in Decomposition scope ledger mapped to PKG-005 and DEL-05-02.

Statement: DEL-05-02 traces to OBJ-005: Demonstrate durability and ease of maintenance (15 pts)
EvidenceQuote: OBJ-005: Demonstrate durability and ease of maintenance (15 pts)
Notes: FACT. OBJ-005 confirmed in Decomposition objectives table as second-highest technical criterion (15 pts).

Statement: DEL-05-02 traces to DEC-009: PKG-005 split into four discipline deliverables to ensure no discipline overlooked
EvidenceQuote: The decomposition decision DEC-009 splits OBJ-005 into four discipline-level deliverables
Notes: FACT. DEC-009 documented in Decomposition decision log. Governs the discipline-split structure of PKG-005.

Statement: DEL-05-02 requires structural system selection and foundation approach from DEL-02-03 before durability narrative can be written
EvidenceQuote: Structural Concept (DEL-02-03) ... Must be available before detailed durability narrative is written
Notes: FACT. Procedure explicitly states DEL-02-03 must be available before narrative development. Confirms frame type and foundation approach.

Statement: DEL-05-02 requires coordination with DEL-05-01 on cladding-structure boundary moisture management and exterior finishes affecting structural water management
EvidenceQuote: Interface at cladding-structure boundary; exterior finishes affecting structural water management
Notes: FACT. Bidirectional interface. Datasheet cross-ref and Procedure Step A5 and Specification R-STR-18 all confirm coordination requirement.

Statement: DEL-05-02 requires sump drainage design inputs from DEL-05-03 (pump outlet size and drain routing and overflow elevation) for sump detail design
EvidenceQuote: Sump includes adequate drainage ... sized and located in coordination with mechanical design (DEL-05-03)
Notes: FACT. R-STR-13 and Procedure Step B2 both explicitly require mechanical design input for sump drainage. CON-003 identifies this interface boundary.

Statement: DEL-05-02 provides sump shell design and structural protection to DEL-05-03 for mechanical drainage system integration
EvidenceQuote: Structural (this deliverable): Sump shell design ... Mechanical (DEL-05-03): Sump interior drainage
Notes: FACT. Guidance C-005 and Specification CON-003 define the structural-to-mechanical handover for sump design.

Statement: DEL-05-02 provides sealed penetration details for electrical conduit routing through structural elements
EvidenceQuote: Electrical service routing through structural elements; cable tray mounting; conduit protection
Notes: FACT. Datasheet cross-ref and Procedure Step A5 confirm interface. Specification R-STR-15 requires sealed penetrations.

Statement: DEL-05-02 requires the 2021 geotechnical investigation report (USG1123) as primary input for foundation durability and concrete parameters
EvidenceQuote: Geotechnical Investigation Report (USG1123 Feb. 12 2021) ... Key parameters: frost depth 2.0 m; groundwater 3.0-4.0 m BG; sulphate S-2
Notes: FACT. Report is primary source for all foundation and concrete durability parameters. No additional investigation authorized (DEC-013).

Statement: DEL-05-02 requires RFP Section 7.1.4 evaluation criteria defining the durability narrative scope and scoring (15 pts)
EvidenceQuote: RFP s7.1.4 (Durability Evaluation Criterion) ... Defines evaluation criteria and narrative scope; 15 evaluation points
Notes: FACT. RFP 7.1.4 is the authoritative source for evaluation criteria and narrative scope.

Statement: DEL-05-02 is constrained by Addendum 03: bay sumps required (s1.8) and 16 ft overhead door minimum (s1.10)
EvidenceQuote: Apparatus bays and PW bays shall be provided with sumps (confirmed required per Addendum 03 s1.8)
Notes: FACT. Addendum 03 s1.8 and s1.10 directly constrain structural sump and door framing requirements.
